project.teaser: The WA3.1 FCDI project aims to specify and develop the future Technologies coming from the CNS in order to support and manage the Operational Services, like the 4D Trajectory Management, in the future ATM System. Performance requirements for CNS systems are becoming...
project.objective: The WA3.1 FCDI project aims to specify and develop the future Technologies coming from the CNS in order to support and manage the Operational Services, like the 4D Trajectory Management, in the future ATM System. Performance requirements for CNS systems are becoming increasingly complex and demanding and need to be considered as part of an integrated and holistic System of Systems, which includes air and ground CNS solutions considering convergence towards a common infrastructure, and a unified concept of operations, where possible. In parallel, CNS systems and infrastructure for both airborne and ground must take a more business- and performance oriented approach with efficient use of resources delivering the required capability in a cost-effective and spectrum efficient manner. The R&I results will enable the full implementation of concepts such as infrastructure as a service to facilitate the complete decoupling of service provision (infrastructure services, information services and all other ANSs) from the physical location of the infrastructure, as outlined in the target architecture specified in the European ATM Master Plan (R&I need: enabling the deployment of a performance-based CNS service offer).
project.title: Future Connectivity and Digital Infrastructure
project.keywords: Datalink, LDACS, IPS, Interoperabilty, HyperConnected ATM, Multilink, FCI, Cyber Security, Space Based CNS, VOICE

article.title: Innovative CNS technologies for the future ATM system

result.teaser: This project is addressing the development of solutions for connectivity between all stakeholders via high-bandwidth, low-latency fixed and mobile networks leveraging state-of-the-art technologies (e.g. broadband connectivity, cloud services, IoT) and the delivery of the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: FCDI TRL4 Initial TS/IRS - FCI Services - IPS Enhancements
result.description: The Initial Technical Specification (TS/IRS) is a deliverable; it will contain a first version of requirements as reference for the prototype development. This deliverable will not contain Part II (Safety Risk Assessment Report) and Part III (Security Risk Assessment Report) as these will be part of the Final TS/IRS. The document is led by FRQ with the contribution of AIRBUS, AIRTEL, ALTYS, RCF, CAI, ENAIRE, HONEYWELL and SITA FR, SITA ES.

result.title: FCDI - First Annual Project Report 2024
result.description: This deliverable will provide the status of the project in terms of progress respect to the plan.

result.title: FCDI TRL4 Initial STAND - Hyper Connectivity Precursor
result.description: The Standardization deliverable is a PMP document It summarizes the solution activities in relation to standardization global harmonization participation in events etc covering the period life of project The deliverable is led by AIRBUS OPERATIONS SAS with contribution and review of all Task 5 partners ie AIRBUS AIRTEL ALTYS RCF CAI ALES ENAIRE SITA FR SITA ES THALES AVS THALES UK

result.title: FCDI- Project Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable is the guideline for the benefit of all FCDI consortium members that: • provides an overview of the project.• explains the project management mechanisms, tools and practices for the daily work performed in the project details the project activities during the execution.• presents the key contractual rules to be followed by the consortium.

result.title: FCDI TRL3 Initial STAND - Collaborative Cyber Security

result.description: The Regulatory deliverable is a PMP document. It summarizes the solution activities in relation to regulatory activities with participation in events etc. covering the period life of project. The document is led by RCF with review of WP2 / T4 contributors.

result.title: FCDI TRL3 Intermediate STAND - Collaborative Cyber Security Framework for CNS
result.description: The Standardization deliverable is a PMP document. It summarizes the solution activities in relation to standardization, global harmonization, participation in events etc. covering the period life of project. The document is led by RCF with review of WP2 / T4 contributors.

result.title: FCDI TRL4 Initial TS/IRS - Hyper Connected ATM Precursor
result.description: The Initial Technical Specification (TS/IRS) is a deliverable; it will contains a first version of requirements as reference for the prototypes development. The document is led by AIRBUS OPERATIONS SAS with contribution and review of all Task 1 partners, i.e. AIRTEL, ALTYS, RCF, CAI, ALES, ENAIRE, SITA FR, SITA ES, THALES AVS, THALES UK

result.title: FCDI TRL6 Initial TS/IRS - FCI Terrestrial Datalink - LDACS
result.description: The Initial Technical Specification (TS/IRS) is a deliverable; it will contain a first version of requirements as reference for the prototype developments, including Avionic Architecture and Airborne Prototype Specification. The document is led by LEONARDO with contributions of AIRTEL, ALTYS, RCF, CAI, FREQUENTIS, SITA FR, SITA ES, R&S. This deliverable will not contain Part II (Safety Risk Assessment Report) and Part III (Security Risk Assessment Report) as these will be part of the Final TS/IRS.

result.title: FCDI TRL3 Initial TS/IRS - Collaborative Cyber Security Framework for CNS

result.title: FCDI TRL4 Initial STAND - IPS Enhancements

result.description: The CDE deliverable is a PMP document. It will provide the plan suitable to connect the relevant target audience with the project key objectives by means of appropriate communication tools. The deliverable is led by LDO.

result.description: This deliverable will provide the information on where you shall find the data used/elaborated in the project and how to access them.

result.description: This deliverable will provide the information on where you shall find the data used/elaborated in the project and how to access them.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
category.description: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
